{"step_by_step_thinking": "Platelet derived growth factor (PDGF) is a protein that plays a crucial role in wound healing and tissue repair. It is released from platelets, which are small cell fragments involved in blood clotting. PDGF is stored in alpha granules within platelets and is released when platelets are activated. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Alpha granules.", "answer_choice": "D"}
